events.description: Fired when an alarm has expired. Useful for transient background pages.
events.name: onAlarm

parameters.description: The alarm that has expired.
parameters.name: name

functions.description: Creates an alarm. After the delay is expired, the onAlarm event is fired. If there is another alarm with the same name (or no name if none is specified), it will be cancelled and replaced by this alarm.
functions.name: create

parameters.description: Optional name to identify this alarm. Defaults to the empty string.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Details about the alarm. The alarm first fires either at 'when' milliseconds past the epoch (if 'when' is provided), after 'delayInMinutes' minutes from the current time (if 'delayInMinutes' is provided instead), or after 'periodInMinutes' minutes from the current time (if only 'periodInMinutes' is provided). Users should never provide both 'when' and 'delayInMinutes'. If 'periodInMinutes' is provided, then the alarm recurs repeatedly after that many minutes.
parameters.name: alarmInfo

delayInMinutes.description: Number of minutes from the current time after which the alarm should first fire.

periodInMinutes.description: Number of minutes after which the alarm should recur repeatedly.

when.description: Time when the alarm is scheduled to first fire, in milliseconds past the epoch.

functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified alarm.
functions.name: get

parameters.description: The name of the alarm to get. Defaults to the empty string.
parameters.name: name

functions.description: Gets an array of all the alarms.
functions.name: getAll

functions.description: Clears the alarm with the given name.
functions.name: clear

parameters.description: The name of the alarm to clear. Defaults to the empty string.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Whether an alarm of the given name was found to clear.
parameters.name: wasCleared

functions.description: Clears all alarms.
functions.name: clearAll

parameters.description: Whether any alarm was found to clear.
parameters.name: wasCleared

periodInMinutes.description: When present, signals that the alarm triggers periodically after so many minutes.

scheduledTime.description: Time when the alarm is scheduled to fire, in milliseconds past the epoch.

description: Use the browser.bookmarks API to create, organize, and otherwise manipulate bookmarks. Also see $(topic:override)[Override Pages], which you can use to create a custom Bookmark Manager page.

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is created.
events.name: onCreated

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is removed.  When a folder is removed recursively, a single notification is fired for the folder, and none for its contents.
events.name: onRemoved

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder changes. Note: Currently, only title and url changes trigger this.
events.name: onChanged

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is moved to a different parent folder.
events.name: onMoved

events.description: Fired when the children of a folder have changed their order due to the order being sorted in the UI.  This is not called as a result of a move().
events.name: onChildrenReordered

events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is begun.  Expensive observers should ignore onCreated updates until onImportEnded is fired.  Observers should still handle other notifications immediately.
events.name: onImportBegan

events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is ended.
events.name: onImportEnded

functions.description: Retrieves the specified BookmarkTreeNode(s).

parameters.description: A single string-valued id, or an array of string-valued ids

choices.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.
An object specifying properties and values to match when searching. Produces bookmarks matching all properties.

query.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.

title.description: The title of the bookmark; matches verbatim.

url.description: The URL of the bookmark; matches verbatim. Note that folders have no URL.

parameters.description: Either a string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles, or an object. If an object, the properties query, url, and title may be specified and bookmarks matching all specified properties will be produced.

functions.description: Exports bookmarks to an html bookmark file
functions.name: export

types.description: Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator or by the custodian of a supervised user. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).
Indicates the type of a BookmarkTreeNode, which can be one of bookmark, folder or separator.
A node (either a bookmark or a folder) in the bookmark tree.  Child nodes are ordered within their parent folder.

children.description: An ordered list of children of this node.

dateAdded.description: When this node was created, in milliseconds since the epoch (new Date(dateAdded)).

dateGroupModified.description: When the contents of this folder last changed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the browser is restarted.

index.description: The 0-based position of this node within its parent folder.

parentId.description: The id of the parent folder. Omitted for the root node.

title.description: The text displayed for the node.

type.description: Indicates the type of the BookmarkTreeNode, which can be one of bookmark, folder or separator.

unmodifiable.description: Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator or by the custodian of a supervised user. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).

url.description: The URL navigated to when a user clicks the bookmark. Omitted for folders.

types.description: Object passed to the create() function.

parentId.description: Defaults to the Other Bookmarks folder.

type.description: Indicates the type of BookmarkTreeNode to create, which can be one of bookmark, folder or separator.

description: Use browser actions to put icons in the main browser toolbar, to the right of the address bar. In addition to its icon, a browser action can also have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup.

events.description: Fired when a browser action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the browser action has a popup.
events.name: onClicked

functions.description: Sets the title of the browser action. This shows up in the tooltip.
functions.name: setTitle

title.description: The string the browser action should display when moused over.

functions.description: Gets the title of the browser action.
functions.name: getTitle

functions.description: Sets the icon for the browser action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.
functions.name: setIcon

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the browser action's icon.
functions.name: setPopup

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this browser action.
functions.name: getPopup

functions.description: Sets the badge text for the browser action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.
functions.name: setBadgeText

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.description: Gets the badge text of the browser action. If no tab nor window is specified is specified, the global badge text is returned.
functions.name: getBadgeText

functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.
functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor

functions.description: Gets the background color of the browser action badge.
functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor

functions.description: Sets the text color for the badge.
functions.name: setBadgeTextColor

functions.description: Gets the text color of the browser action badge.
functions.name: getBadgeTextColor

functions.description: Enables the browser action for a tab. By default, browser actions are enabled.
functions.name: enable

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Disables the browser action for a tab.
functions.name: disable

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Checks whether the browser action is enabled.
functions.name: isEnabled

functions.description: Opens the extension popup window in the active window.
functions.name: openPopup

types.description: Specifies to which tab or window the value should be set, or from which one it should be retrieved. If no tab nor window is specified, the global value is set or retrieved.

tabId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified tab, and will automatically reset when the tab navigates. When getting, specifies the tab to get the value from; if there is no tab-specific value, the window one will be inherited.

windowId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified window. When getting, specifies the window to get the value from; if there is no window-specific value, the global one will be inherited.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.

description: Use the browser.browserSettings API to control global settings of the browser.

allowPopupsForUserEvents.description: Allows or disallows pop-up windows from opening in response to user events.

cacheEnabled.description: Enables or disables the browser cache.

closeTabsByDoubleClick.description: This boolean setting controls whether the selected tab can be closed with a double click.

contextMenuShowEvent.description: Controls after which mouse event context menus popup. This setting's value is of type ContextMenuMouseEvent, which has possible values of mouseup and mousedown.

homepageOverride.description: Returns the value of the overridden home page. Read-only.

imageAnimationBehavior.description: Controls the behaviour of image animation in the browser. This setting's value is of type ImageAnimationBehavior, defaulting to normal.

newTabPageOverride.description: Returns the value of the overridden new tab page. Read-only.

newTabPosition.description: Controls where new tabs are opened. `afterCurrent` will open all new tabs next to the current tab, `relatedAfterCurrent` will open only related tabs next to the current tab, and `atEnd` will open all tabs at the end of the tab strip. The default is `relatedAfterCurrent`.

openBookmarksInNewTabs.description: This boolean setting controls whether bookmarks are opened in the current tab or in a new tab.

openSearchResultsInNewTabs.description: This boolean setting controls whether search results are opened in the current tab or in a new tab.

openUrlbarResultsInNewTabs.description: This boolean setting controls whether urlbar results are opened in the current tab or in a new tab.

overrideDocumentColors.description: This setting controls whether the user-chosen colors override the page's colors.

useDocumentFonts.description: This setting controls whether the document's fonts are used.

types.description: How images should be animated in the browser.
After which mouse event context menus should popup.

description: Use the chrome.browsingData API to remove browsing data from a user's local profile.

types.description: Options that determine exactly what data will be removed.

hostnames.description: Only remove data associated with these hostnames (only applies to cookies and localStorage).

originTypes.description: An object whose properties specify which origin types ought to be cleared. If this object isn't specified, it defaults to clearing only "unprotected" origins. Please ensure that you really want to remove application data before adding 'protectedWeb' or 'extensions'.

extension.description: Extensions and packaged applications a user has installed (be _really_ careful!).

protectedWeb.description: Websites that have been installed as hosted applications (be careful!).

since.description: Remove data accumulated on or after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch (accessible via the getTime method of the JavaScript Date object). If absent, defaults to 0 (which would remove all browsing data).

types.description: A set of data types. Missing data types are interpreted as false.

cache.description: The browser's cache. Note: when removing data, this clears the entire cache: it is not limited to the range you specify.

description: Use the browser.cookies API to query and modify cookies, and to be notified when they change.

events.description: Fired when a cookie is set or removed. As a special case, note that updating a cookie's properties is implemented as a two step process: the cookie to be updated is first removed entirely, generating a notification with "cause" of "overwrite" .  Afterwards, a new cookie is written with the updated values, generating a second notification with "cause" "explicit".
events.name: onChanged

cause.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change.

cookie.description: Information about the cookie that was set or removed.

removed.description: True if a cookie was removed.

functions.description: Retrieves information about a single cookie. If more than one cookie of the same name exists for the given URL, the one with the longest path will be returned. For cookies with the same path length, the cookie with the earliest creation time will be returned.
functions.name: get

parameters.description: Details to identify the cookie being retrieved.
parameters.name: details

firstPartyDomain.description: The first-party domain which the cookie to retrieve is associated. This attribute is required if First-Party Isolation is enabled.

name.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to look for the cookie. By default, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

url.description: The URL with which the cookie to retrieve is associated. This argument may be a full URL, in which case any data following the URL path (e.g. the query string) is simply ignored. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie. This parameter is null if no such cookie was found.
parameters.name: cookie

functions.description: Retrieves all cookies from a single cookie store that match the given information.  The cookies returned will be sorted, with those with the longest path first.  If multiple cookies have the same path length, those with the earliest creation time will be first.
functions.name: getAll

parameters.description: Information to filter the cookies being retrieved.
parameters.name: details

domain.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose domains match or are subdomains of this one.

firstPartyDomain.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose first-party domains match this one. This attribute is required if First-Party Isolation is enabled. To not filter by a specific first-party domain, use `null` or `undefined`.

path.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose path exactly matches this string.

secure.description: Filters the cookies by their Secure property.

session.description: Filters out session vs. persistent cookies.

storeId.description: The cookie store to retrieve cookies from. If omitted, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

url.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those that would match the given URL.

parameters.description: All the existing, unexpired cookies that match the given cookie info.
parameters.name: cookies

functions.description: Sets a cookie with the given cookie data; may overwrite equivalent cookies if they exist.
functions.name: set

parameters.description: Details about the cookie being set.
parameters.name: details

domain.description: The domain of the cookie. If omitted, the cookie becomes a host-only cookie.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

firstPartyDomain.description: The first-party domain of the cookie. This attribute is required if First-Party Isolation is enabled.

httpOnly.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as HttpOnly. Defaults to false.

name.description: The name of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

path.description: The path of the cookie. Defaults to the path portion of the url parameter.

secure.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as Secure. Defaults to false.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to set the cookie. By default, the cookie is set in the current execution context's cookie store.

url.description: The request-URI to associate with the setting of the cookie. This value can affect the default domain and path values of the created cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

value.description: The value of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been set.  If setting failed for any reason, this will be "null", and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.
parameters.name: cookie

functions.description: Deletes a cookie by name.
functions.name: remove

parameters.description: Information to identify the cookie to remove.
parameters.name: details

firstPartyDomain.description: The first-party domain associated with the cookie. This attribute is required if First-Party Isolation is enabled.

name.description: The name of the cookie to remove.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store to look in for the cookie. If unspecified, the cookie is looked for by default in the current execution context's cookie store.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been removed.  If removal failed for any reason, this will be "null", and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.
parameters.name: details

firstPartyDomain.description: The first-party domain associated with the cookie that's been removed.

name.description: The name of the cookie that's been removed.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store from which the cookie was removed.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie that's been removed.

functions.description: Lists all existing cookie stores.
functions.name: getAllCookieStores

parameters.description: All the existing cookie stores.
parameters.name: cookieStores

types.description: A cookie's 'SameSite' state (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies). 'no_restriction' corresponds to a cookie set without a 'SameSite' attribute, 'lax' to 'SameSite=Lax', and 'strict' to 'SameSite=Strict'.
Represents information about an HTTP cookie.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Not provided for session cookies.

firstPartyDomain.description: The first-party domain of the cookie.

hostOnly.description: True if the cookie is a host-only cookie (i.e. a request's host must exactly match the domain of the cookie).

httpOnly.description: True if the cookie is marked as HttpOnly (i.e. the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts).

sameSite.description: The cookie's same-site status (i.e. whether the cookie is sent with cross-site requests).

secure.description: True if the cookie is marked as Secure (i.e. its scope is limited to secure channels, typically HTTPS).

session.description: True if the cookie is a session cookie, as opposed to a persistent cookie with an expiration date.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store containing this cookie, as provided in getAllCookieStores().

types.description: Represents a cookie store in the browser. An incognito mode window, for instance, uses a separate cookie store from a non-incognito window.

id.description: The unique identifier for the cookie store.

incognito.description: Indicates if this is an incognito cookie store

tabIds.description: Identifiers of all the browser tabs that share this cookie store.

types.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change. If a cookie was inserted, or removed via an explicit call to $(ref:cookies.remove), "cause" will be "explicit". If a cookie was automatically removed due to expiry, "cause" will be "expired". If a cookie was removed due to being overwritten with an already-expired expiration date, "cause" will be set to "expired_overwrite".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to garbage collection, "cause" will be "evicted".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to a "set" call that overwrote it, "cause" will be "overwrite". Plan your response accordingly.

description: Use the chrome.devtools.inspectedWindow API to interact with the inspected window: obtain the tab ID for the inspected page, evaluate the code in the context of the inspected window, reload the page, or obtain the list of resources within the page.

events.description: Fired when a new resource is added to the inspected page.

events.description: Fired when a new revision of the resource is committed (e.g. user saves an edited version of the resource in the Developer Tools).

functions.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression in the context of the main frame of the inspected page. The expression must evaluate to a JSON-compliant object, otherwise an exception is thrown. The eval function can report either a DevTools-side error or a JavaScript exception that occurs during evaluation. In either case, the result parameter of the callback is undefined. In the case of a DevTools-side error, the isException parameter is non-null and has isError set to true and code set to an error code. In the case of a JavaScript error, isException is set to true and value is set to the string value of thrown object.
functions.name: eval

parameters.description: An expression to evaluate.
parameters.name: expression

parameters.description: The options parameter can contain one or more options.
parameters.name: options

contextSecurityOrigin.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of a content script of an extension that matches the specified origin. If given, contextSecurityOrigin overrides the 'true' setting on userContentScriptContext.

frameURL.description: If specified, the expression is evaluated on the iframe whose URL matches the one specified. By default, the expression is evaluated in the top frame of the inspected page.

useContentScriptContext.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of the content script of the calling extension, provided that the content script is already injected into the inspected page. If not, the expression is not evaluated and the callback is invoked with the exception parameter set to an object that has the isError field set to true and the code field set to E_NOTFOUND.

parameters.description: A function called when evaluation completes.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: The result of evaluation.
parameters.name: result

parameters.description: An object providing details if an exception occurred while evaluating the expression.
parameters.name: exceptionInfo

code.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

description.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

details.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated, contains the array of the values that may be substituted into the description string to provide more information about the cause of the error.

isError.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

isException.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

value.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

functions.description: Reloads the inspected page.

ignoreCache.description: When true, the loader will bypass the cache for all inspected page resources loaded before the load event is fired. The effect is similar to pressing Ctrl+Shift+R in the inspected window or within the Developer Tools window.

injectedScript.description: If specified, the script will be injected into every frame of the inspected page immediately upon load, before any of the frame's scripts. The script will not be injected after subsequent reloads—for example, if the user presses Ctrl+R.

preprocessorScript.deprecated: Please avoid using this parameter, it will be removed soon.
preprocessorScript.description: If specified, this script evaluates into a function that accepts three string arguments: the source to preprocess, the URL of the source, and a function name if the source is an DOM event handler. The preprocessorerScript function should return a string to be compiled by Chrome in place of the input source. In the case that the source is a DOM event handler, the returned source must compile to a single JS function.

userAgent.description: If specified, the string will override the value of the User-Agent HTTP header that's sent while loading the resources of the inspected page. The string will also override the value of the navigator.userAgent property that's returned to any scripts that are running within the inspected page.

functions.description: Download a URL. If the URL uses the HTTP[S] protocol, then the request will include all cookies currently set for its hostname. If both filename and saveAs are specified, then the Save As dialog will be displayed, pre-populated with the specified filename. If the download started successfully, callback will be called with the new DownloadItem's downloadId. If there was an error starting the download, then callback will be called with downloadId=undefined and chrome.extension.lastError will contain a descriptive string. The error strings are not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. You must not parse it.

The image returned by this function while a download is in progress may be different from the image returned after the download is complete. Icon retrieval is done by querying the underlying operating system or toolkit depending on the platform. The icon that is returned will therefore depend on a number of factors including state of the download, platform, registered file types and visual theme. If a file icon cannot be determined, chrome.extension.lastError will contain an error message.

types.description: <dl><dt>file</dt><dd>The download's filename is suspicious.</dd><dt>url</dt><dd>The download's URL is known to be malicious.</dd><dt>content</dt><dd>The downloaded file is known to be malicious.</dd><dt>uncommon</dt><dd>The download's URL is not commonly downloaded and could be dangerous.</dd><dt>safe</dt><dd>The download presents no known danger to the user's computer.</dd></dl>These string constants will never change, however the set of DangerTypes may change.

<dl><dt>in_progress</dt><dd>The download is currently receiving data from the server.</dd><dt>interrupted</dt><dd>An error broke the connection with the file host.</dd><dt>complete</dt><dd>The download completed successfully.</dd></dl>These string constants will never change, however the set of States may change.

bytesReceived.description: Number of bytes received so far from the host, without considering file compression.

danger.description: Indication of whether this download is thought to be safe or known to be suspicious.

endTime.description: Number of milliseconds between the unix epoch and when this download ended.

error.description: Number indicating why a download was interrupted.

fileSize.description: Number of bytes in the whole file post-decompression, or -1 if unknown.

id.description: An identifier that is persistent across browser sessions.

incognito.description: False if this download is recorded in the history, true if it is not recorded.

paused.description: True if the download has stopped reading data from the host, but kept the connection open.

startTime.description: Number of milliseconds between the unix epoch and when this download began.

state.description: Indicates whether the download is progressing, interrupted, or complete.

totalBytes.description: Number of bytes in the whole file, without considering file compression, or -1 if unknown.

url.description: Absolute URL.

types.description: A time specified as a Date object, a number or string representing milliseconds since the epoch, or an ISO 8601 string
Parameters that combine to specify a predicate that can be used to select a set of downloads.  Used for example in search() and erase()

bytesReceived.description: Number of bytes received so far from the host, without considering file compression.

danger.description: Indication of whether this download is thought to be safe or known to be suspicious.

endedAfter.description: Limits results to downloads that ended after the given ms since the epoch.

endedBefore.description: Limits results to downloads that ended before the given ms since the epoch.

fileSize.description: Number of bytes in the whole file post-decompression, or -1 if unknown.

filenameRegex.description: Limits results to DownloadItems whose filename matches the given regular expression.

limit.description: Setting this integer limits the number of results. Otherwise, all matching DownloadItems will be returned.

orderBy.description: Setting elements of this array to DownloadItem properties in order to sort the search results. For example, setting orderBy='startTime' sorts the DownloadItems by their start time in ascending order. To specify descending order, prefix orderBy with a hyphen: '-startTime'.

paused.description: True if the download has stopped reading data from the host, but kept the connection open.

query.description: This array of search terms limits results to DownloadItems whose filename or url contain all of the search terms that do not begin with a dash '-' and none of the search terms that do begin with a dash.

startedAfter.description: Limits results to downloads that started after the given ms since the epoch.

startedBefore.description: Limits results to downloads that started before the given ms since the epoch.

state.description: Indicates whether the download is progressing, interrupted, or complete.

totalBytes.description: Number of bytes in the whole file, without considering file compression, or -1 if unknown.

totalBytesGreater.description: Limits results to downloads whose totalBytes is greater than the given integer.

totalBytesLess.description: Limits results to downloads whose totalBytes is less than the given integer.

url.description: Absolute URL.

urlRegex.description: Limits results to DownloadItems whose url matches the given regular expression.

types.description: Filters URLs for various criteria. See event filtering. All criteria are case sensitive.

hostContains.description: Matches if the host name of the URL contains a specified string. To test whether a host name component has a prefix 'foo', use hostContains: '.foo'. This matches 'www.foobar.com' and 'foo.com', because an implicit dot is added at the beginning of the host name. Similarly, hostContains can be used to match against component suffix ('foo.') and to exactly match against components ('.foo.'). Suffix- and exact-matching for the last components need to be done separately using hostSuffix, because no implicit dot is added at the end of the host name.

hostEquals.description: Matches if the host name of the URL is equal to a specified string.

hostPrefix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL starts with a specified string.

hostSuffix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL ends with a specified string.

originAndPathMatches.description: Matches if the URL without query segment and fragment identifier matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

pathContains.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL contains a specified string.

pathEquals.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

pathPrefix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

pathSuffix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

ports.description: Matches if the port of the URL is contained in any of the specified port lists. For example [80, 443, [1000, 1200]] matches all requests on port 80, 443 and in the range 1000-1200.

choices.description: A pair of integers identiying the start and end (both inclusive) of a port range.

queryContains.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL contains a specified string.

queryEquals.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

queryPrefix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

querySuffix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

schemes.description: Matches if the scheme of the URL is equal to any of the schemes specified in the array.

urlContains.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) contains a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlEquals.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) is equal to a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlMatches.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

urlPrefix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) starts with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlSuffix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) ends with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

file.description: JavaScript or CSS file to inject.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame to inject the script into. This may not be used in combination with allFrames.

matchAboutBlank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also injected in about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. Code cannot be inserted in top-level about:-frames. By default it is false.

runAt.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

types.description: A plain JSON value

description: Use the browser.find API to interact with the browser's Find interface.

functions.description: Search for text in document and store found ranges in array, in document order.
functions.name: find

parameters.description: The string to search for.
parameters.name: queryphrase

parameters.description: Search parameters.
parameters.name: params

caseSensitive.description: Find only ranges with case sensitive match.

entireWord.description: Find only ranges that match entire word.

includeRangeData.description: Return range data which provides range data in a serializable form.

includeRectData.description: Return rectangle data which describes visual position of search results.

tabId.description: Tab to query. Defaults to the active tab.

functions.description: Highlight a range
functions.name: highlightResults

parameters.description: highlightResults parameters
parameters.name: params

rangeIndex.description: Found range to be highlighted. Default highlights all ranges.

tabId.description: Tab to highlight. Defaults to the active tab.

functions.description: Remove all highlighting from previous searches.
functions.name: removeHighlighting

parameters.description: Tab to highlight. Defaults to the active tab.
parameters.name: tabId

description: Exposes the browser's profiler.

events.description: Fires when the profiler starts/stops running.
events.name: onRunning

parameters.description: Whether the profiler is running or not. Pausing the profiler will not affect this value.
parameters.name: isRunning

functions.description: Starts the profiler with the specified settings.
functions.name: start

bufferSize.description: The maximum size in bytes of the buffer used to store profiling data. A larger value allows capturing a profile that covers a greater amount of time.

features.description: A list of active features for the profiler.

interval.description: Interval in milliseconds between samples of profiling data. A smaller value will increase the detail of the profiles captured.

threads.description: A list of thread names for which to capture profiles.

windowLength.description: The length of the window of time that's kept in the buffer. Any collected samples are discarded as soon as they are older than the number of seconds specified in this setting. Zero means no duration restriction.

functions.description: Stops the profiler and discards any captured profile data.
functions.name: stop

functions.description: Pauses the profiler, keeping any profile data that is already written.
functions.name: pause

functions.description: Resumes the profiler with the settings that were initially used to start it.
functions.name: resume

functions.description: Gathers the profile data from the current profiling session, and writes it to disk. The returned promise resolves to a path that locates the created file.
functions.name: dumpProfileToFile

parameters.description: The name of the file inside the profile/profiler directory
parameters.name: fileName

functions.description: Gathers the profile data from the current profiling session.
functions.name: getProfile

functions.description: Gathers the profile data from the current profiling session. The returned promise resolves to an array buffer that contains a JSON string.
functions.name: getProfileAsArrayBuffer

functions.description: Gathers the profile data from the current profiling session. The returned promise resolves to an array buffer that contains a gzipped JSON string.
functions.name: getProfileAsGzippedArrayBuffer

functions.description: Gets the debug symbols for a particular library.
functions.name: getSymbols

parameters.description: The name of the library's debug file. For example, 'xul.pdb
parameters.name: debugName

parameters.description: The Breakpad ID of the library
parameters.name: breakpadId

description: Use the browser.history API to interact with the browser's record of visited pages. You can add, remove, and query for URLs in the browser's history. To override the history page with your own version, see $(topic:override)[Override Pages].

events.description: Fired when a URL is visited, providing the HistoryItem data for that URL.  This event fires before the page has loaded.
events.name: onVisited

events.description: Fired when one or more URLs are removed from the history service.  When all visits have been removed the URL is purged from history.
events.name: onVisitRemoved

allHistory.description: True if all history was removed.  If true, then urls will be empty.

events.description: Fired when the title of a URL is changed in the browser history.
events.name: onTitleChanged

title.description: The new title for the URL.

url.description: The URL for which the title has changed

functions.description: Searches the history for the last visit time of each page matching the query.
functions.name: search

endTime.description: Limit results to those visited before this date.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.  Defaults to 100.

startTime.description: Limit results to those visited after this date. If not specified, this defaults to 24 hours in the past.

text.description: A free-text query to the history service.  Leave empty to retrieve all pages.

functions.description: Retrieves information about visits to a URL.
functions.name: getVisits

url.description: The URL for which to retrieve visit information.  It must be in the format as returned from a call to history.search.

functions.description: Adds a URL to the history with a default visitTime of the current time and a default $(topic:transition-types)[transition type] of "link".
functions.name: addUrl

transition.description: The $(topic:transition-types)[transition type] for this visit from its referrer.

url.description: The URL to add. Must be a valid URL that can be added to history.

visitTime.description: The date when this visit occurred.

functions.description: Removes all occurrences of the given URL from the history.
functions.name: deleteUrl

url.description: The URL to remove.

functions.description: Removes all items within the specified date range from the history.  Pages will not be removed from the history unless all visits fall within the range.
functions.name: deleteRange

endTime.description: Items added to history before this date.

startTime.description: Items added to history after this date.

functions.description: Deletes all items from the history.
functions.name: deleteAll

types.description: The $(topic:transition-types)[transition type] for this visit from its referrer.
An object encapsulating one result of a history query.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

lastVisitTime.description: When this page was last loaded, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

title.description: The title of the page when it was last loaded.

typedCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page by typing in the address.

url.description: The URL navigated to by a user.

visitCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page.

types.description: An object encapsulating one visit to a URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

referringVisitId.description: The visit ID of the referrer.

transition.description: The $(topic:transition-types)[transition type] for this visit from its referrer.

visitId.description: The unique identifier for this visit.

visitTime.description: When this visit occurred, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

description: Use the browser.i18n infrastructure to implement internationalization across your whole app or extension.

functions.description: Gets the accept-languages of the browser. This is different from the locale used by the browser; to get the locale, use $(ref:i18n.getUILanguage).
functions.name: getAcceptLanguages

parameters.description: Array of LanguageCode
parameters.name: languages

functions.description: Gets the localized string for the specified message. If the message is missing, this method returns an empty string (''). If the format of the getMessage() call is wrong — for example, messageName is not a string or the substitutions array has more than 9 elements — this method returns undefined.
functions.name: getMessage

parameters.description: The name of the message, as specified in the $(topic:i18n-messages)[messages.json] file.
parameters.name: messageName

parameters.description: Substitution strings, if the message requires any.
parameters.name: substitutions

returns.description: Message localized for current locale.

functions.description: Gets the browser UI language of the browser. This is different from $(ref:i18n.getAcceptLanguages) which returns the preferred user languages.
functions.name: getUILanguage

returns.description: The browser UI language code such as en-US or fr-FR.

functions.description: Detects the language of the provided text using CLD.
functions.name: detectLanguage

parameters.description: User input string to be translated.
parameters.name: text

parameters.description: LanguageDetectionResult object that holds detected langugae reliability and array of DetectedLanguage
parameters.name: result

items.description: DetectedLanguage object that holds detected ISO language code and its percentage in the input string

percentage.description: The percentage of the detected language

types.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. For an unknown language, und will be returned, which means that [percentage] of the text is unknown to CLD

description: Use the chrome.identity API to get OAuth2 access tokens.

events.description: Fired when signin state changes for an account on the user's profile.

functions.description: Retrieves a list of AccountInfo objects describing the accounts present on the profile.

functions.description: Gets an OAuth2 access token using the client ID and scopes specified in the oauth2 section of manifest.json.

functions.description: Retrieves email address and obfuscated gaia id of the user signed into a profile.

functions.description: Removes an OAuth2 access token from the Identity API's token cache.
functions.name: removeCachedAuthToken

functions.description: Generates a redirect URL to be used in |launchWebAuthFlow|.
functions.name: getRedirectURL

parameters.description: The path appended to the end of the generated URL.

types.description: An object encapsulating an OAuth account id.

description: Use the browser.idle API to detect when the machine's idle state changes.

events.description: Fired when the system changes to an active or idle state. The event fires with "idle" if the the user has not generated any input for a specified number of seconds, and "active" when the user generates input on an idle system.
events.name: onStateChanged

functions.description: Returns "idle" if the user has not generated any input for a specified number of seconds, or "active" otherwise.
functions.name: queryState

parameters.description: The system is considered idle if detectionIntervalInSeconds seconds have elapsed since the last user input detected.
parameters.name: detectionIntervalInSeconds

functions.description: Sets the interval, in seconds, used to determine when the system is in an idle state for onStateChanged events. The default interval is 60 seconds.
functions.name: setDetectionInterval

parameters.description: Threshold, in seconds, used to determine when the system is in an idle state.
parameters.name: intervalInSeconds

dialogMessage.description: The message to display to a user when being asked to confirm removal of the extension.

showConfirmDialog.description: Whether or not a confirm-uninstall dialog should prompt the user. Defaults to false.

types.description: Information about an icon belonging to an extension.

size.description: A number representing the width and height of the icon. Likely values include (but are not limited to) 128, 48, 24, and 16.

url.description: The URL for this icon image. To display a grayscale version of the icon (to indicate that an extension is disabled, for example), append ?grayscale=true to the URL.

types.description: A reason the item is disabled.
The type of this extension, 'extension' or 'theme'.

How the extension was installed. One of
development: The extension was loaded unpacked in developer mode,
normal: The extension was installed normally via an .xpi file,
sideload: The extension was installed by other software on the machine,
other: The extension was installed by other means.
Information about an installed extension.

disabledReason.description: A reason the item is disabled.

enabled.description: Whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

homepageUrl.description: The URL of the homepage of this extension.

hostPermissions.description: Returns a list of host based permissions.

icons.description: A list of icon information. Note that this just reflects what was declared in the manifest, and the actual image at that url may be larger or smaller than what was declared, so you might consider using explicit width and height attributes on img tags referencing these images. See the manifest documentation on icons for more details.

mayDisable.description: Whether this extension can be disabled or uninstalled by the user.

optionsUrl.description: The url for the item's options page, if it has one.

permissions.description: Returns a list of API based permissions.

shortName.description: A short version of the name of this extension.

type.description: The type of this extension, 'extension' or 'theme'.

updateUrl.description: The update URL of this extension.

versionName.description: The version name of this extension if the manifest specified one.

types.description: Common properties for all manifest.json files
Represents a WebExtension manifest.json file

additionalProperties.deprecated: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest

types.description: Represents a WebExtension language pack manifest.json file
Represents a WebExtension dictionary manifest.json file

dark.description: The dark icon to use for light themes

light.description: A light icon to use for dark themes

types.description: Same as MatchPattern above, but excludes <all_urls>

Mostly unrestricted match patterns for privileged add-ons. This should technically be rejected for unprivileged add-ons, but, reasons. The MatchPattern class will still refuse privileged schemes for those extensions.

Details of the script or CSS to inject. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time. Based on InjectDetails, but using underscore rather than camel case naming conventions.

all_frames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only injected into the top frame.

css.description: The list of CSS files to inject

js.description: The list of JS files to inject

match_about_blank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also injected in about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. Code cannot be inserted in top-level about:-frames. By default it is false.

run_at.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

description: Use the browser.contextMenus API to add items to the browser's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'tab' and 'tools_menu'.

description: Use the browser.menus API to add items to the browser's menus. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

events.description: Fired when a context menu item is clicked.
events.name: onClicked

parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.
parameters.name: info

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. If the click did not take place in a tab, this parameter will be missing.
parameters.name: tab

events.description: Fired when a menu is shown. The extension can add, modify or remove menu items and call menus.refresh() to update the menu.
events.name: onShown

parameters.description: Information about the context of the menu action and the created menu items. For more information about each property, see OnClickData. The following properties are only set if the extension has host permissions for the given context: linkUrl, linkText, srcUrl, pageUrl, frameUrl, selectionText.
parameters.name: info

contexts.description: A list of all contexts that apply to the menu.

menuIds.description: A list of IDs of the menu items that were shown.

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the menu was opened.
parameters.name: tab

events.description: Fired when a menu is hidden. This event is only fired if onShown has fired before.
events.name: onHidden

functions.description: Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in $(ref:runtime.lastError)).
functions.name: create

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

command.description: Specifies a command to issue for the context click.  Currently supports internal commands _execute_page_action, _execute_browser_action and _execute_sidebar_action.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see $(topic:match_patterns)[Match Patterns].

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Mandatory for event pages. Cannot be the same as another ID for this extension.

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked. Event pages cannot use this; instead, they should register a listener for $(ref:contextMenus.onClicked).

parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.
parameters.name: info

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.
parameters.name: tab

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

viewTypes.description: List of view types where the menu item will be shown. Defaults to any view, including those without a viewType.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

parameters.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in $(ref:runtime.lastError).
parameters.name: callback

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

functions.description: Updates a previously created context menu item.
functions.name: update

parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.
parameters.name: updateProperties

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.
parameters.name: tab

parentId.description: Note: You cannot change an item to be a child of one of its own descendants.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been updated.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Removes a context menu item.

parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.

parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been removed.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Removes all context menu items added by this extension.

parameters.description: Called when removal is complete.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Show the matching menu items from this extension instead of the default menu. This should be called during a 'contextmenu' DOM event handler, and only applies to the menu that opens after this event.
functions.name: overrideContext

bookmarkId.description: Required when context is 'bookmark'. Requires 'bookmark' permission.

context.description: ContextType to override, to allow menu items from other extensions in the menu. Currently only 'bookmark' and 'tab' are supported. showDefaults cannot be used with this option.

showDefaults.description: Whether to also include default menu items in the menu.

tabId.description: Required when context is 'tab'. Requires 'tabs' permission.

functions.description: Updates the extension items in the shown menu, including changes that have been made since the menu was shown. Has no effect if the menu is hidden. Rebuilding a shown menu is an expensive operation, only invoke this method when necessary.
functions.name: refresh

ACTION_MENU_TOP_LEVEL_LIMIT.description: The maximum number of top level extension items that can be added to an extension action context menu. Any items beyond this limit will be ignored.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'tab' and 'tools_menu'.
The type of menu item.
Information sent when a context menu item is clicked.

bookmarkId.description: The id of the bookmark where the context menu was clicked, if it was on a bookmark.

button.description: An integer value of button by which menu item was clicked.

checked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item after it is clicked.

editable.description: A flag indicating whether the element is editable (text input, textarea, etc.).

frameId.description: The id of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked.

frameUrl.description: The URL of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked, if it was in a frame.

linkText.description: If the element is a link, the text of that link.

linkUrl.description: If the element is a link, the URL it points to.

mediaType.description: One of 'image', 'video', or 'audio' if the context menu was activated on one of these types of elements.

menuItemId.description: The ID of the menu item that was clicked.

modifiers.description: An array of keyboard modifiers that were held while the menu item was clicked.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page where the menu item was clicked. This property is not set if the click occured in a context where there is no current page, such as in a launcher context menu.

parentMenuItemId.description: The parent ID, if any, for the item clicked.

selectionText.description: The text for the context selection, if any.

srcUrl.description: Will be present for elements with a 'src' URL.

targetElementId.description: An identifier of the clicked element, if any. Use menus.getTargetElement in the page to find the corresponding element.

viewType.description: The type of view where the menu is clicked. May be unset if the menu is not associated with a view.

wasChecked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item before it was clicked.

description: The part of the menus API that is available in all extension contexts, including content scripts.

The supported tags are 'url' (for a literal URL), 'match' (for highlighting text that matched what the user's query), and 'dim' (for dim helper text). The styles can be nested, eg. <dim><match>dimmed match</match></dim>. You must escape the five predefined entities to display them as text: stackoverflow.com/a/1091953/89484

description: Use the browser.pageAction API to put icons inside the address bar. Page actions represent actions that can be taken on the current page, but that aren't applicable to all pages.

events.description: Fired when a page action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the page action has a popup.
events.name: onClicked

functions.description: Shows the page action. The page action is shown whenever the tab is selected.
functions.name: show

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Hides the page action.
functions.name: hide

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Checks whether the page action is shown.
functions.name: isShown

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the shownness from.

functions.description: Sets the title of the page action. This is displayed in a tooltip over the page action.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.description: Gets the title of the page action.
functions.name: getTitle

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the title from.

functions.description: Sets the icon for the page action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.
functions.name: setIcon

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the page action's icon.
functions.name: setPopup

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

networkPredictionEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser attempts to speed up your web browsing experience by pre-resolving DNS entries, prerendering sites (<link rel='prefetch' ...>), and preemptively opening TCP and SSL connections to servers. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

peerConnectionEnabled.description: Allow users to enable and disable RTCPeerConnections (aka WebRTC).

webRTCIPHandlingPolicy.description: Allow users to specify the media performance/privacy tradeoffs which impacts how WebRTC traffic will be routed and how much local address information is exposed. This preference's value is of type IPHandlingPolicy, defaulting to default.

types.description: The IP handling policy of WebRTC.

description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

passwordSavingEnabled.description: If enabled, the password manager will ask if you want to save passwords. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

cookieConfig.description: Allow users to specify the default settings for allowing cookies, as well as whether all cookies should be created as non-persistent cookies. This setting's value is of type CookieConfig.

firstPartyIsolate.description: If enabled, the browser will associate all data (including cookies, HSTS data, cached images, and more) for any third party domains with the domain in the address bar. This prevents third party trackers from using directly stored information to identify you across different websites, but may break websites where you login with a third party account (such as a Facebook or Google login.) The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is false.

hyperlinkAuditingEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser sends auditing pings when requested by a website (<a ping>). The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

protectedContentEnabled.description: Available on Windows and ChromeOS only: If enabled, the browser provides a unique ID to plugins in order to run protected content. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

referrersEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser sends referer headers with your requests. Yes, the name of this preference doesn't match the misspelled header. No, we're not going to change it. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

resistFingerprinting.description: If enabled, the browser attempts to appear similar to other users by reporting generic information to websites. This can prevent websites from uniquely identifying users. Examples of data that is spoofed include number of CPU cores, precision of JavaScript timers, the local timezone, and disabling features such as GamePad support, and the WebSpeech and Navigator APIs. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is false.

thirdPartyCookiesAllowed.description: If disabled, the browser blocks third-party sites from setting cookies. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

trackingProtectionMode.description: Allow users to specify the mode for tracking protection. This setting's value is of type TrackingProtectionModeOption, defaulting to private_browsing_only.

types.description: The mode for tracking protection.
The settings for cookies.

behavior.description: The type of cookies to allow.

nonPersistentCookies.description: Whether to create all cookies as nonPersistent (i.e., session) cookies.

description: Use the browser.proxy API to register proxy scripts in Firefox. Proxy scripts in Firefox are proxy auto-config files with extra contextual information and support for additional return types.

events.description: Fired when proxy data is needed for a request.

extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.
extraParameters.name: filter

extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.
extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec

events.name: onRequest

cookieStoreId.description: The cookie store ID of the contextual identity.

documentUrl.description: URL of the page into which the requested resource will be loaded.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

fromCache.description: Indicates if this response was fetched from disk cache.

ip.description: The server IP address that the request was actually sent to. Note that it may be a literal IPv6 address.

originUrl.description: URL of the resource that triggered this request.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP request headers that are going to be sent out with this request.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

events.description: Notifies about errors caused by the invalid use of the proxy API.
events.name: onError

functions.name: unregister

functions.name: registerProxyScript

settings.description: Configures proxy settings. This setting's value is an object of type ProxyConfig.

types.description: An object which describes proxy settings.

autoConfigUrl.description: A URL to use to configure the proxy.

autoLogin.description: Do not prompt for authentication if password is saved.

ftp.description: The address of the ftp proxy, can include a port.

http.description: The address of the http proxy, can include a port.

httpProxyAll.description: Use the http proxy server for all protocols.

passthrough.description: A list of hosts which should not be proxied.

ssl.description: The address of the ssl proxy, can include a port.

description: Use the browser.runtime API to retrieve the background page, return details about the manifest, and listen for and respond to events in the app or extension lifecycle. You can also use this API to convert the relative path of URLs to fully-qualified URLs.

events.description: Fired when a profile that has this extension installed first starts up. This event is not fired for incognito profiles.
events.name: onStartup

events.description: Fired when the extension is first installed, when the extension is updated to a new version, and when the browser is updated to a new version.
events.name: onInstalled

id.description: Indicates the ID of the imported shared module extension which updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'shared_module_update'.

previousVersion.description: Indicates the previous version of the extension, which has just been updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'update'.

reason.description: The reason that this event is being dispatched.

temporary.description: Indicates whether the addon is installed as a temporary extension.

events.description: Sent to the event page just before it is unloaded. This gives the extension opportunity to do some clean up. Note that since the page is unloading, any asynchronous operations started while handling this event are not guaranteed to complete. If more activity for the event page occurs before it gets unloaded the onSuspendCanceled event will be sent and the page won't be unloaded.
events.name: onSuspend

events.description: Sent after onSuspend to indicate that the app won't be unloaded after all.
events.name: onSuspendCanceled

events.description: Fired when an update is available, but isn't installed immediately because the app is currently running. If you do nothing, the update will be installed the next time the background page gets unloaded, if you want it to be installed sooner you can explicitly call $(ref:runtime.reload). If your extension is using a persistent background page, the background page of course never gets unloaded, so unless you call $(ref:runtime.reload) manually in response to this event the update will not get installed until the next time the browser itself restarts. If no handlers are listening for this event, and your extension has a persistent background page, it behaves as if $(ref:runtime.reload) is called in response to this event.
events.name: onUpdateAvailable

parameters.description: The manifest details of the available update.
parameters.name: details

version.description: The version number of the available update.

events.description: Fired when an update for the browser is available, but isn't installed immediately because a browser restart is required.
events.name: onBrowserUpdateAvailable

events.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script.

events.description: Fired when a message is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).
parameters.name: sendResponse

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.description: Fired when a message is sent from another extension/app. Cannot be used in a content script.

parameters.name: sendResponse

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.description: Fired when an app or the device that it runs on needs to be restarted. The app should close all its windows at its earliest convenient time to let the restart to happen. If the app does nothing, a restart will be enforced after a 24-hour grace period has passed. Currently, this event is only fired for Chrome OS kiosk apps.

This is useful for content scripts connecting to their extension processes, inter-app/extension communication, and $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging]. Note that this does not connect to any listeners in a content script. Extensions may connect to content scripts embedded in tabs via $(ref:tabs.connect).

If sending to your extension, the $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event will be fired in each page, or $(ref:runtime.onMessageExternal), if a different extension. Note that extensions cannot send messages to content scripts using this method. To send messages to content scripts, use $(ref:tabs.sendMessage).
